DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Pulmonary Metastatic Spread Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Date of metastatic spread of a malignant neoplasm to the lungs. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the lungs._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004_(MET-uh-STAT-ik) Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from one part of the body to another._The act of extending over a wider scope or expanse of space or time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to the lungs.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: Relating to the lungs as the intended site of administration, where the pharmaceutical product is administered, usually by inhalation, for local action in the lower respiratory tract or for systemic action after absorption via the lower respiratory tract.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: (MET-uh-STAT-ik) Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from one part of the body to another.:The act of extending over a wider scope or expanse of space or time.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
The act of extending over a wider scope or expanse of space or time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: revised to provide naming consistency for related elements

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Date as required for Clinical Trials Monitoring Service submissions.  Exchange format is YYYYMMDD.  Display format is DDMMMYYYY, with the month display the first three letters of each month (Jan, Feb, Mar, etc.).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/30/17 jk Transferred context, added CSI and reg status, released per Round 5 finalization task. --- Display and exchange formats are based on CTMS reporting requirements v.3.02 and all subsequent versions of these guidelines.
